task_summary: Detect the pot lid, grasp its handle with a pinch strategy, lift the lid vertically, and retreat while holding it clear of the pot.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator with a parallel gripper must remove a small round lid from a metal pot placed on a tabletop. The robot observes the scene, aligns to the lidâ€™s handle, and performs a precise pinch grasp. After establishing contact and grasp, it lifts the lid vertically to clear the pot, then retreats slightly to a safe position. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, careful alignment, gentle approach until contact, and a clean vertical lift to avoid scraping the pot rim.
preconditions: Robot and camera have line-of-sight to the pot lid
Workspace is clear around the pot
Gripper operational and open at start
Kinematics allow approach from the side/top
stepwise_plan: Detect the lid and verify visibility
Move above the pot to a pregrasp height and set yaw
Compute a pinch grasp for the lid handle
Align, descend until contact, and execute the grasp
Lift vertically to clear the pot
success_criteria: Lid is lifted vertically clear of the pot rim without collision
Robot retreats to a safe pose while holding the lid
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-scan and adjust view
If alignment fails, recompute grasp and re-approach
If grasp slips, reopen, re-align, and retry with the same grasp key
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends after retreat once the lid is elevated and clear of the pot.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: lift up a lid from the pot

node_specs.description: Perceive the lid location before motion
Move to a safe pregrasp height above the pot
Compute pinch grasp on the lid handle and store key
Orient end-effector to align with handle
Descend gently until contact with handle
Lift vertically to clear pot rim
Back off to a safe holding pose

failure_modes: Lid not detected due to glare or blur
Contact not sensed and over-travel occurs
recovery_strategy: Recompute grasp with same key and re-approach
Abort descent on excessive force, raise, re-align
Open gripper, reset pregrasp, and retry sequence
assumptions: Frames show a metallic pot with a small round lid and graspable handle; side pinch is feasible
Minor image blur requires conservative descent until contact
Instruction matches frames; no conflict observed

expected_success_criteria: Lid secured and lifted above pot rim by at least 0.1 m
No collisions with pot body during lift
